channel.title: String wrapper
channel.description: What is the string wrapper class? What exactly is it used for? Is it created by ZKM?

item.title: String wrapper
item.dc:creator: @solarwind solarwind
item.description:
@solarwind wrote:

[quote=“Ollie, post:14, topic:188750”]on the contrary, couldnt this be found out easily enough without help.
when i first started out with hacking the client the text was the FIRST thing i looked at, i looked at how they wrapped the text and how they used the mutableString.newInstance(“text”) method to generate the instance of the class. (its in all the static string fields (e.g. string xg = mb.newStringInstance(“null”); ), they use that method)

im sorry if i sound like a dickhead, but i thought it was pretty trivial :s[/quote]
It may be trivial or obvious to you but not to others.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: March 24, 2008, 11:17:28 AM[/size][hr]I found much of the information on this thread very useful.

Read full topic

item.title: String wrapper
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

on the contrary, couldnt this be found out easily enough without help.
when i first started out with hacking the client the text was the FIRST thing i looked at, i looked at how they wrapped the text and how they used the mutableString.newInstance(“text”) method to generate the instance of the class. (its in all the static string fields (e.g. string xg = mb.newStringInstance(“null”); ), they use that method)

im sorry if i sound like a dickhead, but i thought it was pretty trivial :s

Read full topic

item.title: String wrapper
item.dc:creator: @super_OLDACCOUNT super_OLDACCOUNT
item.description:
@super_OLDACCOUNT wrote:

no such thing. there IS a class used to wrap a byte array and use it to represent some string of text

Read full topic

item.title: String wrapper
item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

[quote=“BAsh(CntLgn), post:9, topic:188750”][quote author=frank_ link=topic=251541.msg2106514#msg2106514 date=1205408389]
ps. it isnt limited
[/quote]

Constructs a new String by decoding the specified subarray of bytes using the platform’s default charset.

As a result I think it can use any encoding. It works with German right? (is it German?)[/quote]
yeah, it works with any character, hold alt and spam a char code, it workses

Read full topic

ps. it isnt limited

Constructs a new String by decoding the specified subarray of bytes using the platform's default charset.
As a result I think it can use any encoding. It works with German right? (is it German?)

item.title: String wrapper
item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

[quote=“unlimitedorb, post:6, topic:188750”][quote author=solarwind link=topic=251541.msg2105745#msg2105745 date=1205380916]
What is the string wrapper class? What exactly is it used for? Is it created by ZKM?
[/quote]
The string wrapper class is a class that jagex has whipped up to make up for inefficiencies within the original “String” class in java. It’s a severely limited class which only accepts 256 characters (instead of 65535 like string) but also retains the bonus of less memory usage.

It also has special escape characters and is designed for runescapes ENTIRE engine.[/quote]
you suck, why use extra bytes when you can (and do) make a multibyte encoding style???

ps. it isnt limited

Read full topic

item.title: String wrapper
item.dc:creator: @solarwind solarwind
item.description:
@solarwind wrote:

[quote=“unlimitedorb, post:6, topic:188750”][quote author=solarwind link=topic=251541.msg2105745#msg2105745 date=1205380916]
What is the string wrapper class? What exactly is it used for? Is it created by ZKM?
[/quote]
The string wrapper class is a class that jagex has whipped up to make up for inefficiencies within the original “String” class in java. It’s a severely limited class which only accepts 256 characters (instead of 65535 like string) but also retains the bonus of less memory usage.

It also has special escape characters and is designed for runescapes ENTIRE engine.[/quote]
Yeah, now I get it. Thanks! It’s just a byte array containing the string. The string can be created like this: new String(stringWrapper.getbytes(), 0, stringWrapper.getLength());

Read full topic

item.title: String wrapper
item.dc:creator: @Fasga Fasga
item.description:
@Fasga wrote:

It could be argued that it’s not the “String wrapper” class, because it does not wrap a string. It is used internally throughout the client to represent strings of characters (strings). It is not created by ZKM.

Read full topic
